column4: just delete the virtual xp machine and rebuild it if it becomes compromised. that is the whole philosophy behind virtualality
can i save my ubuntu folder created via wubi and format my drive and reinstall the ubuntu file system from that folder that wubi created?
i'm sorry i did it this way now. i love my current configuration for ubuntu and i doubt i will ever get it back like this again. blah.

applesauce  : most of the files you will really need will be in your /home, unless you have some config stuff (in /etc) that you changed. you can copy your home elsewhere and try. im not sure, though, never used wubi myself
